questions.question: What are the base units for the metric system?

choices.answer: meter, gram, and liter
m, g, L
km, kg, kL
mm, mg, mL

questions.question: How many milliliters are there in a L?

choices.answer: 6 kg
60 kg
6 g

questions.question: How do you convert 30 centimeters into millimeters?

choices.answer: I figure out if I am changing from smaller to larger units.
I figure out if I am changing from larger to smaller units.
I use the relationship between centi- and milli-.
I write 300 mm.

questions.question: How would you explain 1 cm to another student?

choices.answer: Say it is 1/100 of a meter
Say it is 100 times smaller than a meter.
Say it is 100 times bigger than a meter.
Say a meter is 100 times bigger than a centimeter.

questions.question: If I had 36 mL and 3 L, what is the first step in combining these measurements?

choices.answer: I add 36 and 3 together to get 39L
I add 36 and 3 together to get 39 mL
I convert both values to either mL or L
I multiply 3 by 1000 to obtain the value in mL

questions.question: A desk is 120 cm.  The wall where it is supposed to go is 1.15 m.  Will the desk fit?

choices.answer: Yes, it will make it by 5 cm
No, it will not fit by 5 cm
Yes, it will make it by 5 m
No, it will not fit by 5 m.

questions.question: The difference betwen kilo- and the base unit is

choices.answer: the base unit is 1,000 times bigger than kilo-
kilo is 1,000 times smaller than the base unit.
kilo- is 1,000 times bigger than the base unit.
the base unit is 1,000 times smaller than kilo-.
6 mm
6 m
6 cm
600 cm
6 m
